video.title: React Tutorial: Weather App with RESTful APIs
video.description:
Lean how to use React to create a weather app using RESTful APIs.

💻Github Repo: https://github.com/ipenywis/React-Weather-App

Tutorial from IPenywis. Check out their YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCMm15RFnHUvM-aSc50e7R9A

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: Amine A
topLevelComment.text: forecasts are no longer free on this API :'(

topLevelComment.author: houssem kh'i
topLevelComment.text: i have a problem fetching the data from the API

replies.author: Kevin Ford
replies.text: This is because the forecast portion of that API is no longer available to free accounts. You will probably want to look at another weather API

topLevelComment.author: Alejandro Balderas
topLevelComment.text: The reason why you have to put on the index when importing your component is because you were missing a "/" at the end to tell react that you want the files inside the folder

topLevelComment.author: Max S.
topLevelComment.text: Can someone send me the code pls?

topLevelComment.author: Sajal Shrestha
topLevelComment.text: Why didn't you use asyn and await? Can anybody tell me?

topLevelComment.author: Andrew Dillon
topLevelComment.text: Why does everyone I see set a class  with extends Component when you can just do that with the import?

topLevelComment.author: Rick Sanchez
topLevelComment.text: Which browser is he using? Firefox dev edition? I love his dev tools

topLevelComment.author: The Homeless Romantic
topLevelComment.text:
Awesome man!
great job, i learned a lot!!
